snippet: Having failed to secure the nomination in the first two months of voting, Mitt Romney is turning, his aides say, to a methodical delegate accumulation similar to President Obama’s 2008 campaign.
abstract: Mitt Romney, having failed to emerge as a strong frontrunner before the Super Tuesday contests, has, along with his advisers, devised an approach to the second half of the primary campaign geared to methodically amassing the 1,144 delegates necessary to win the nomination; strategy, which ignores big popular vote victories, bears striking similarities to the one used successfully by Pres Obama in the 2008 election.
lead_paragraph: Having failed to secure the nomination in the first two months of voting, Mitt Romney is turning, his aides say, to a methodical delegate accumulation similar to President Obama’s 2008 campaign.

headline.seo: Romney Focuses on Delegate Tally in Race With Santorum
headline.main: Romney Traces Obama’s Path on Delegates
headline.print_headline: Romney Traces Obama’s Path On Delegates
